item.title: FTC orders GM to stop collecting and selling driver’s data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has announced action against General Motors (GM) and its subsidiary, OnStar, for unlawful collection and sale of drivers' precise geolocation and driving behavior data without first obtaining their consent. [...]

item.title: Microsoft removes Assassin’s Creed Windows 11 upgrade blocks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Earlier this week, Ubisoft released Assassin's Creed Valhalla and Assassin's Creed Origins patches to fix Windows 11 24H2 compatibility issues that caused crashes, freezes, and audio problems. [...]

item.title: FTC cracks down on Genshin Impact gacha loot box practices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Genshin Impact developer Cognosphere (aka Hoyoverse) has agreed to a $20 million settlement with the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) over its gacha loot box monetization and is now banned from selling them to teens under the age of sixteen without parental consent. [...]

item.title: Otelier data breach exposes info, hotel reservations of millions
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Hotel management platform Otelier suffered a data breach after threat actors breached its Amazon S3 cloud storage to steal millions of guests' personal information and reservations for well-known hotel brands like Marriott, Hilton, and Hyatt. [...]

item.title: Malicious PyPi package steals Discord auth tokens from devs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malicious package named 'pycord-self' on the Python package index (PyPI) targets Discord developers to steal authentication tokens and plant a backdoor for remote control over the system. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Office 365 apps crashing on Windows Server systems
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue that caused Microsoft 365 applications and Classic Outlook to crash on Windows Server 2016 or Windows Server 2019 systems. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Chinese firm, hacker behind telecom and Treasury hacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) has sanctioned Yin Kecheng, a Shanghai-based hacker for his role in the recent Treasury breach and a company associated with the Salt Typhoon threat group. [...]

item.title: FCC orders telecoms to secure their networks after Salt Tyhpoon hacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has ordered U.S. telecommunications carriers to secure their networks following last year's Salt Typhoon security breaches. [...]

item.title: Microsoft starts force upgrading Windows 11 22H2, 23H3 devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has started the forced rollout of Windows 11 24H2 to eligible, non-managed systems running the Home and Pro editions of Windows 11 22H2 and 23H2. [...]

item.title: GDPR complaints filed against TikTok, Temu for sending user data to China
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Non-profit privacy advocacy group "None of Your Business" (noyb) has filed six complaints against TikTok, AliExpress, SHEIN, Temu, WeChat, and Xiaomi, for unlawfully transferring European user's data to China and infringing European Union's general data protection regulation (GDPR). [...]

item.title: W3 Total Cache plugin flaw exposes 1 million WordPress sites to attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A severe flaw in the W3 Total Cache plugin installed on more than one million WordPress sites could give attackers access to various information, including metadata on cloud-based apps. [...]

item.title: Microsoft expands testing of Windows 11 admin protection feature
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has expanded its Windows 11 administrator protection tests, allowing Insiders to enable the security feature from the Windows Security settings. [...]
